intro: Valerianella costata, commonly known as mountain sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges, often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pinkish flowers arranged in loose clusters. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. Valerianella costata is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky areas.
